thread.title: Manchester City fly out to Abu Dhabi after beating Monaco | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Manchester City fly out to Abu Dhabi after beating Monaco | Daily Mail Online

author: Jack Bezants For Mailonline
title: Manchester City fly out to Abu Dhabi after beating Monaco | Daily Mail Online
text: Share City were made to work hard before emerging victorious against Monaco on Tuesday. They fell behind to he French side twice before fighting back to record a 5-3 victory, helped by a double from Sergio Aguero and goals from Raheem Sterling, John Stones and Leroy Sane, Radamel Falcao scored twice for Monaco and starlet Kylian Mbappe also hit the back of the net. As City were getting set to leave Manchester after the match, they would have no doubt been surprised to spot former Manchester United defender Jaap Stam at the airport. Guardiola had two goals from Sergio Aguero to thank for helping City beat Monaco Reading boss Jaap Stam was at the airport - his side lost 1-0 to Huddersfield on Tuesday The Reading manager was heading back to Berkshire with his team after heading north to play Huddersfield in the Championship. And it was David Wagner's side who took the three points in the battle between the promotion hopefuls thanks to an 82nd minute goal from Philip Billing. Reading are fourth in the Championship on 60 points, four behind third-place Huddersfield. Share or comment on this article Most watched Sport videos
